"Monty Python and the Holy Grail" ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Mist.  Several seconds of it swirling about.  silence possibly, atmospheric music.  SUPERIMPOSE "England AD 787 after a few more seconds we hear hoofbeats in the distanc They come slowly closer.  Then out of the mist comes KING followed by a SERVANT who is banging two half coconuts together.   ARTHUR raises his hand. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa there! SERVANT makes noises of horses halting, with a flourish. peers through the mist.  CUT TO shot from over his should castle (e.g. Bodium) rising out of the mist.  On the cast battlements a SOLDIER is dimly seen.  He peers down. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt!  Who goes there? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is I, Arthur, son of Uther Pendragon, from the castle of Camelot.  King of all Britons, defeator of the Saxons, sovereign of all England! Pause. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am...  And this my trusty servant, Patsy. We have ridde length and breadth of the land in search of knights who w our court at Camelot..  I must speak with your lord and m SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Ridden on a horse? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're using coconuts! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What? SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got two empty halves of coconuts and you're bangin them together. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Scornfully) So?  We have ridden since the snows of winter covered thi land, through the kingdom of Mercea. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get the coconuts? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through ... We found them. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found them?  In Mercea.  The coconut's tropical! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is a temperate zone. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The swallow may fly south with the sun, or the house mart or the plover seek warmer hot lands in winter, yet these not strangers to our land. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you suggesting coconuts migrate? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.  They could be carried. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? A swallow carrying a coconut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: |       Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: |       I'll tell you why not ... because a swallow is ab |       inches long and weighs five ounces, and you'd be |       to find a coconut under a pound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could grip it by the husk ... SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a question of where he grips it,  It's a simple matter of weight - ratios ...  A five-ounce bird could no hold a a one pound coconut. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it doesn't matter.   Go and tell your master that Arthur from the Court of Camelot is here. A Slight pause.  Swirling mist.  Silence. SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! To maintain Velocity, a swallow needs to beat its wings four hundred and ninety three times every second.   right? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) Please! SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I right? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested. SECOND SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (who has loomed up on the battlements) It could be carried by an African swallow! FIRST SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh  yes! An African swallow maybe ... but not a European swallow. that's my point. SECOND SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, I agree there ... ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing patience) Will you ask your master if he wants to join the Knights of Camelot?! FIRST SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then of course African swallows are non-migratory. SECOND SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes. ARTHUR raises his eyes heavenwards and nods to PATSY.  Th and go off into the mist. FIRST SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they wouldn't be able to bring a coconut back anyway. SECOND SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Suppose two swallows carried it together? FIRST SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they'd have to have it on a line. Stillness.  Silence again.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATION/LIVE ACTION SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: CUT TO Terry Gilliam's sequence of Brueghel prints.  Soun strange medieval music.  Discordant and sparse.  Wailings groanings.  The last picture mixes through into live acti BIG CLOSE UP of contorted face upside down.  A leg falls it.  Creaking noise.  The bodies lurch away from CAMERA t reveal they are amongst a huge pile of bodies on a swayin that is lumbering away from CAMERA.  It is pulled by a co ragged, dirty emaciated WRETCHES.  Behind the cart walks MAN who looks slightly more prosperous, but only on the s of complete and utter impoverishment.  He wears a black h looks sinister. CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring out your dead! We follow the cart through a wretched, impoverished plagu village.  A few starved mongrels run about in the mud sca In the open doorway of one house perhaps we jug glimpse a legs dangling from the ceiling.  In another doorway an OL is beating a cat against a wall rather like one does with The cart passes round a dead donkey or cow in the mud.  A tied to a cart is being hammered to death by four NUNS wi huge mallets. CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring out your dead! There are legs stick out of windows and doors.  Two MEN a in the mud - covered from head to foot in it.  Another MA hands in knees shovelling mud into his mouth.  We just ca sight of a MAN falling into a well. CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring out your dead! LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's one! CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninepence. BODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dead! CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... There's your ninepence. BODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dead! CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ere.  He says he's not dead. LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes he is. BODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not! CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't. LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will be soon. He's very ill. BODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting better! LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not.   You'll be stone dead in a few minutes. CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take him like this.  It's against regulations. BODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go on the cart. LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be such a baby. CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take him. BODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel fine. LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favour. CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can you hang around a couple of minutes.  He won't be long. CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised I'd be at the Robinson's.  They've lost nine today. LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's your next round? CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thursday. BODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll go for a walk. LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not fooling anyone you know. (to CART DRIVER) Isn't there anything you could do? BODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing unrecognisably) I feel happy... I feel happy. The CART DRIVER looks at the LARGE MAN for a moment.  The do a quick furtive look up and down the street.  The CART very swiftly brings up a club and hits the OLD MAN. (Out but the singing stops after a loud bonk noise.) LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing over the money at last) Thanks very much. CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right.  See you on Thursday. They turn ... Suddenly all the village fall to their knee forelocks etc.  ARTHUR and PATSY ride into SHOT, slightly the air, they ride through without acknowledging anybody. they pass, the LARGE MAN turns to the CART DRIVER. LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that then? CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grudgingly) I dunno, Must be a king. LARGE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? CART DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't got shit all over him.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: ARTHUR and PATSY riding.  They stop and look.  We see a c distance, and before it a PEASANT is working away on his to dig up the earth with his bare hands and a twig.  ARTH PATSY ride up, and stop before the PEASANT ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old woman! DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man.  I'm sorry.  Old man, What knight live in that castl over there? DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thirty-seven. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? DENNIS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thirty-seven ... I'm not old. ARTHUR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I can't just say:  "Hey, Man!' DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you could say: "Dennis" ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were called Dennis. DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't bother to find out, did you? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've said I'm sorry about the old woman, but from the beh you looked ... DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I object to is that you automatically treat me like an inferior ... ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ... I AM king. DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, very nice. King, eh!  I expect you've got a palace an clothes and courtiers and plenty of food.  And how d'you By exploiting the workers! By hanging on to outdated impe dogma which perpetuates the social and economic differenc society!  If there's EVER going to be any progress ... An OLD WOMAN appears. OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis! There's some lovely filth down here ...  Oh! how d'you do? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How d'you do, good lady ... I am Arthur, King of the Brit can you tell me who lives in that castle? OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King of the WHO? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Britons. OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are the Britons? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of us are ... we are all Britons. DENNIS winks at the OLD WOMAN. ... and I am your king .... OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh!  I didn't know we had a king.  I thought we were an autonomous collective ... DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fooling yourself.  We're living in a dictatorship, A self-perpetuating autocracy in which the working classe OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are, bringing class into it again ... DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what it's all about ...  If only - ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please good people.  I am in haste.  What knight that castle? OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one live there. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who is your lord? OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a lord. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you,  We're an anarcho-syndicalist commune,  we ta it in turns to act as a sort of executive officer for the ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But all the decision of that officer ... ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I see. DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... must be approved at a bi-weekly meeting by a simple m in the case of purely internal affairs. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet! DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but a two-thirds majority ... ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet!  I order you to shut up. OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order, eh -- who does he think he is? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am your king! OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't vote for you. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't vote for kings. OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how did you become king, then? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lady of the Lake, her arm clad in the purest shimmeri held Excalibur aloft from the bosom of the water to signi Divine Providence ...  that I, Arthur, was to carry Excal That is why I am your king!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: |      Is Frank in?  He'd be able to deal with this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look,  strange women lying on their backs in ponds handin swords ... that's no basis for a system of government.  S executive power derives from a mandate from the masses, n some farcical aquatic ceremony. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet! DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't expect to wield supreme executive power just 'cause some watery tart threw a sword at you! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, if I went around saying I was an Emperor because moistened bint had lobbed a scimitar at me, people would put me away! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Grabbing him by the collar) Shut up, will you. Shut up! DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! NOW ... we see the violence inherent in the system. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! PEOPLE (i.e. other PEASANTS) are appearing and watching. DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Come and see the violence inherent in the system. Help, help, I'm being repressed! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aware that people are now coming out and watching) Bloody peasant! (pushes DENNIS over into mud and prepares to ride off) DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Did you hear that!  What a give-away. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, patsy. They ride off. DENNIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the background as we PULL OUT) did you see him repressing me, then?  That's what I've been on about ...

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: MIX THROUGH to ARTHUR and PATSY riding through the forest stones.  We TRACK with them.  CLOSE-UPS of their faces as MIX to another TRACKING SHOT of them riding through the f come to a clearing and stop, looking ahead intently. Thei Sound FX of fight. CUT TO their eyeline.  A clearing on the other side of wh wooden foot-bridge across a stream.   At the start of the tremendous fight is going on.  A huge BLACK KNIGHT in bla face totally masked in a visor, is fighting a slightly sm green armour.  (Perhaps the GREEN KNIGHT's armour is iden BLACK KNIGHT's save for the colour.) CUT BACK TO ARTHUR and PATSY.  They watch, growing more i as they watch the fight. CUT BACK TO the fight.  The GREEN KNIGHT lunges at the BL avoids the blow with a skillful side-step and parry, knoc out of the GREEN KNIGHT's hand. CUT BACK TO ARTHUR and PATSY even more impressed. CUT BACK TO the fight.  The GREEN KNIGHT has drawn out a mace or spiked ball and chain, much longer than the BLACK ARTHUR narrows his eyes, wondering whether the BLACK KNIG CUT BACK to the fight. The GREEN KNIGHT swings at the BLA ducks under the first swing, leaps over the second and st on the GREEN KNIGHT. CUT BACK TO ARTHUR and PATSY watching like a tennis match fight reaching a climax.  Four almighty clangs.  Then Sil CUT BACK to see the GREEN KNIGHT stretched out.  The BLAC sheathes his sword. ARTHUR looks at PATSY.  Nods and they move forward. CUT BACK TO the BLACK KNIGHT picking up the GREEN KNIGHT and hurling him into the river.  ARTHUR and PATSY approac ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fight with the strength of many men, Sir knight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: |      Who dares to challenge the Black Knight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: |      I do not challenge you. The BLACK KNIGHT stares impassively and says nothing. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Arthur, King of the Britons. Hint of a pause as he waits for a reaction which dosn't c only slightly thrown. ... I seek the bravest and the finest knights in all the world to join me in my court at Camelot ... The BLACK KNIGHT remains silent ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have proved yourself worthy. ... Will you join me? Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: |      A man of your strength and skill would be the chie |      my knights ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: |      Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make me sad.  But so be it.  Come Patsy. As he moves, the BLACK KNIGHT bars the way. BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None shall pass. ARTHUR

dialogues.text: I have no quarrel with you, brave Sir knight, but I must cross this bridge. BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you shall die. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I command you, as King of the Britons to stand aside. BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I move for no man. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be it! ARTHUR draws his sword and approaches the BLACK KNIGHT. now starts lasting about fifteen seconds at which point A a mighty blow which completely severs the BLACK KNIGHT's the shoulder.  ARTHUR steps back triumphantly. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now stand aside worthy adversary. BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Glancing at his shoulder) 'Tis but a scratch. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scratch?  Your arm's off. BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it isn't. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing to the arm on ground) Well, what's that then? BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had worse. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a liar. BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on you pansy! Another ten seconds furious fighting till ARTHUR chops th other arm off, also at the shoulder.  The arm plus sword, ARTHUR

dialogues.text: Victory is mine. (sinking to his knees) I thank thee O Lord that in thy ... BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.text: Come on then. ARTHUR

dialogues.text: You are indeed brave Sir knight, but the fight is mine. BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.text: Had enough? ARTHUR

dialogues.text: You stupid bastard.  You havn't got any arms left. BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.text: Look! BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.text: Stop that. BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.text: Come Here. ARTHUR

dialogues.text: You're a looney. BLACK KNIGHT

dialogues.text: The Black Knight always triumphs. Have at you! ARTHUR takes his last leg off.  The BLACK KNIGHT's body l BLACK KNIGHT
